chapter.title: Welcome to &PRODUCT; 4.1
chapter.para: Welcome to the 4.1.0 release of &PRODUCT;, the first major release from the Apache CloudStack project since its graduation from the Apache Incubator.

This document contains information specific to this release of &PRODUCT;, including upgrade instructions from prior releases, new features added to &PRODUCT;, API changes, and issues fixed in the release. For installation instructions, please see the Installation Guide. For usage and administration instructions, please see the &PRODUCT; Administrator's Guide. Developers and users who wish to work with the API will find instruction in the &PRODUCT; API Developer's Guide
If you find any errors or problems in this guide, please see . We hope you enjoy working with &PRODUCT;!

chapter.title: Upgrade Instructions
chapter.para: This section contains upgrade instructions from prior versions of CloudStack to Apache CloudStack 4.1.0. We include instructions on upgrading to Apache CloudStack from pre-Apache versions of Citrix CloudStack (last version prior to Apache is 3.0.2) and from the releases made while CloudStack was in the Apache Incubator.
If you run into any issues during upgrades, please feel free to ask questions on users@apache.cloudstack.org or dev@apache.cloudstack.org.

section.title: Upgrade from 4.0.x to 4.1.0
section.para: This section will guide you from Apache CloudStack 4.0.x versions (4.0.0-incubating, 4.0.1-incubating, and 4.0.2) to &PRODUCT; 4.1.0.
Any steps that are hypervisor-specific will be called out with a note.

warning.title: Package Structure Changes
warning.para: The package structure for &PRODUCT; has changed significantly since the 4.0.x releases. If you've compiled your own packages, you'll notice that the package names and the number of packages has changed. This is not a bug.
However, this does mean that the procedure is not as simple as an apt-get upgrade or yum update, so please follow this section carefully.

section.para: We recommend reading through this section once or twice before beginning your upgrade procedure, and working through it on a test system before working on a production system.

section.title: Whats New in 4.1
section.para: Apache CloudStack 4.1.0 includes many new features. This section covers the most prominent new features and changes.

section.title: Issues Fixed in 4.1.0
section.para: Apache CloudStack uses Jira to track its issues. All new features and bugs for 4.1.0 have been tracked in Jira, and have a standard naming convention of "CLOUDSTACK-NNNN" where "NNNN" is the issue number.
This section includes a summary of known issues against 4.0.0 that were fixed in 4.1.0.

entry.para: Creating volumes after upgrading from snapshot taken in 2.2.14 no longer deletes the snapshot physically from the secondary storage.
mvn deploydb only creates 4.0 DB, not 4.1

Due to tooling changes between 4.1 and 4.2, CloudStack's database is created using the 4.0 schema and updated to the 4.1 schema when the management server starts for the first time. It's OK to see the same schema if the management server has not started yet.
Service CloudStack-Management is being displayed as cloud-management service

Many scripts and text entries have references to cloud-management rather than cloudstack-management due to the changeover between 4.0 and 4.1 to rename services. This is a minor issue and should be corrected by 4.2.
Service CloudStack-Management is being displayed as cloud-management service
NPE when primary storage is added with wrong path
[UI] Instance which are created without display name are not visible when added to LB
Better Error message when trying to deploy Vm by passing static Ipv4 addresses that are assigned to another VM/IP4 address is outside the iprange.
Warning while adding Xen 6.1 host [Unable to create local link network]
api: zone response lists vlan in it as "vlan range of zone" but the vlan belongs to physical network
[cloud.utils.AnnotationHelper] class java.lang.Stringdoes not have a Table annotation
xen:snapshots:Storage gc fail to clean the failed snapshot images from secondarystorage
Infrastructure view does not show capacity values
Creation of compute offering allow combination of local storage + HA
Virtual Routers do not properly resolve DNS SRV Records
SSVM ID is exposed in the Error Message thrown by AddTrafficType API
Ui should not ask for a vlan range if the physical network isolation type is not VLAN
VPC ACLs are not stored and programmed consistently
console proxy does not support any keymaps besides us, jp
